data.title: Good Food.
data.text: It's a good Ruby Tuesday that they updated from the old design.  The food was good, and the atmosphere was quiet and subdued.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: When I travel for business, I try to stick with chain restaurants unless someone recommends a local place. I stopped here for a late lunch, there were maybe 10 other customers in the restaurant.  I walked in and waited 5 minutes for the manager to finally notice me and seat me. Two waitresses walked past me several times and never glanced my way. Finally I folded the menu and set it at the end of my table, the manager came by and asked if anyone had taken my order...no! She took my order and the waitress finally brought my drink. The salad bar was fine, the crab cakes were more like flat pancakes than crab cakes. Won't be going back to this place again.

data.title: Leaves much to be desired
data.text: Someone regurgitated on the floor & they allowed customer's to walk through it....YUCKY!!! Haven't been back!

data.title: Usual RT Fare
data.text: Unlike other diners' reviews, I enjoyed my meal here, and would return if I was in the area again. The salad bar was fresh, the entrees good, and the service was great. It was no better or worse than your average Ruby Tuesday restaurant, and I welcome that.

data.title: Horrible experience!
data.text:
We went here because we had a coupon for buy one entrée and get the 2nd at 50% off. Otherwise, we would have chosen another place. Turns out that we should have:  First off, upon arrival and walking in the door, we were told that it was hot in there because the air conditioning was broken. Wonderful. We decided to have a drink and see how tolerable it was. For us, it was fine, so we stayed and had a meal, though other guests were obviously hot. Why they stayed was beyond us, because if it was too hot for us, we were all set to get up and leave.
The meal was disappointing. It was both overpriced and barely anything to eat on the plate. $17.99 for five ribs and three chicken tenders with fries is way too much. It was supposed to be half a rack of baby back ribs, but wasn’t. The specialty Ruby drink was delicious, but hardly made up for this overpriced meal. We paid $62.00. It turned out that our coupon expired the day before. Our error. I don’t think I’ll go back unless I should get another coupon. It just isn’t worth it. The food is nothing extra ordinary and service is adequate. The wait staff did an adequate job in attendance despite the A/C not working all day and was tipped accordingly. I was concerned about someone getting dehydrated and told them to stay hydrated. In reality, on a ninety degree day in Mississippi, this Ruby Tuesday should have been shut down over the weekend until they received the part on Monday, but of course the restaurant wouldn’t want to lose money. Considering the ac was broken, I couldn’t figure out why it was so busy.  All in all, I can’t recommend this restaurant, unless the AC is working and you have a coupon to save some money. Perhaps, someone should have informed management that if someone, customer or staff suddenly became ill from the heat, they could have been held liable.

data.title: Worst Experience at This Chain
data.text: It was crowded but since there were only 2 of us we got in quickly.  We were tram felling so first stop was the men's and ladies' rooms - yuck! Paper all over the floor but none in the stall - when the restrooms appear to be unclean you start to wonder what the kitchen looks like. I believe that the parent chain needs to check out this restaurant. Service and food were good. I did tell the hostess that the restrooms needed attention.

data.title: I was not impressed
data.text: The past 2 visits at Ruby's was not great at all. My order was horrible, my waitress took forever on refills, and the salad bar was never was replenished. My order was bitter and tasteless and didn't look pleasing. The small portion was a problem as well. My children glared suspiciously at what was suppose to edible food on their plate. The salad bar was the highlight of my meal OR SO I THOUGHT. It was as pitiful as the squash, mashed potatoes, and whatever else that got left on my plate. No one ever refilled it along with our drinks. The month prior to this one, I ordered seafood that was waay too salty and boring. My waitress was kind atleast but she took years to refill our beverages. I should've complained but I guess I remembered the good food and service that they used to have at the now closed down Metrocenter location several years ago. This location in Pearl is okay but have fallen off tremendously. I do plan to use the great coupon offer soon in hopes of giving them an opportunity to redeem themselves! Please don't let me down (AGAIN)

data.title: Soup & Salad Bar!
data.text: Great place for a quick lunch. Service was fast and friendly and atmosphere was good. Salad bar was fully stocked and fresh.  Soup was yummy. I always stick to soup and salad bar here because it's just plain good. I give em 4 out of 5 forks. Check em out!

data.title: My worst experience ever at Ruby Tuesday
data.text: I've eaten at many Ruby Tuesdays and usually love it. Had this been my first experience with the chain, I would've never been back. The salad bar was good, and thankfully the appetizer was good as well... but the main dish was completely over-priced for what it was, and wasn't even good. The crab cake tasted like salmon, and the plate had about half as much food as the picture on the menu represented. Will never eat here again.

data.title: an okay restaurant.
data.text: very busy on a weekend.  You should probably have reservations if you have a party larger than two or three, which we did.  The food & service was okay once we got seated.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We went to Ruby Tuesday for lunch becasue my husband had good memeories of eating at the chain.  The salad bar was very good,  The pimento-cheese and buffalo chicken sliders were dry and dull.  Garlic mashed potatoes were pasty.
